definition:
Let $G$ be a graph. An *edge covering* $C$ on $G$ is a subset of the
vertices of $G$ such that each edge in $G$ is incident with at least one
vertex in $C$.

For any graph, the vertex set is a trivial edge covering. Generally, we
are more interested in *minimal coverings*. A minimal edge covering is
simply an edge covering of the least possible .
